Fix some amazing night sailing music in Wind Waker WiiU Nintendo! :D

snippet.textDisplay: Best Zelda Game EVER.
snippet.textOriginal: Best Zelda Game EVER.

snippet.textDisplay: I never was a fan of Zelda games. I liked playing one of the GBA games, and I had played the original, but when OOT came, I didn't like it. I tried Twilight Princess and I just didn't get interested. When I got Phantom Hourglass as a gift, I loved it. After hearing of Wind Waker, I went and got it. AMAZING!!! I could not put the attachment to the game into words. Maybe i'm one for the cel shaded graphics, who knows? I do like Okami.
snippet.textOriginal: I never was a fan of Zelda games. I liked playing one of the GBA games, and I had played the original, but when OOT came, I didn't like it. I tried Twilight Princess and I just didn't get interested. When I got Phantom Hourglass as a gift, I loved it. After hearing of Wind Waker, I went and got it. AMAZING!!! I could not put the attachment to the game into words. Maybe i'm one for the cel shaded graphics, who knows? I do like Okami.

snippet.textDisplay: Wind Waker was one of the best Zelda game in my opinion

snippet.textDisplay: Sailing was never the problem for me. It was the, "you missed the spot by like 5 inches," kind of thing. Like you drift too far that the slow movement isn't worth the time and you have to constantly change the wind direction just to get the treasure spot. And if you miss again... DUDE. Otherwise, everything else about this game was alright.
snippet.textOriginal: Sailing was never the problem for me. It was the, "you missed the spot by like 5 inches," kind of thing. Like you drift too far that the slow movement isn't worth the time and you have to constantly change the wind direction just to get the treasure spot. And if you miss again... DUDE. Otherwise, everything else about this game was alright.

snippet.textDisplay:
You’re sailing on, Link (repeat x8)
Onward lad!
O’er the briny sea!
On you sail!
Go...
Bravely to…
Uncharted… 
Lands far from home…
Fearlessly!
Fight evil!
Like a giant squid!
Or some imps!
And…
Big frickin’ birds!
They’re no match…
For your sword!
Or your bombs!
Go!!!
snippet.textOriginal:
You’re sailing on, Link (repeat x8)
Onward lad!
O’er the briny sea!
On you sail!
Go...
Bravely to…
Uncharted… 
Lands far from home…
Fearlessly!
Fight evil!
Like a giant squid!
Or some imps!
And…
Big frickin’ birds!
They’re no match…
For your sword!
Or your bombs!
Go!!!

snippet.textDisplay:
I had lost faith in Zelda, and I didn't really care about Skyward Sword anymore. 
I listened to this song. 
5 seconds later, I ran out and preordered the damn game!
snippet.textOriginal:
I had lost faith in Zelda, and I didn't really care about Skyward Sword anymore. 
I listened to this song. 
5 seconds later, I ran out and preordered the damn game!

snippet.textDisplay: I loved the sailing. Made you feel like an adventurer on the big sea plus it was wide open whereas all other zelda overworlds are boxed in with mountains or hills. I still remember that part when the world is stormy and you have to go back to Windfall island and get the bombs. I was sitting on the sofa all wrapped up and looking outside to see it was also raining. So awesome.
snippet.textOriginal: I loved the sailing. Made you feel like an adventurer on the big sea plus it was wide open whereas all other zelda overworlds are boxed in with mountains or hills. I still remember that part when the world is stormy and you have to go back to Windfall island and get the bombs. I was sitting on the sofa all wrapped up and looking outside to see it was also raining. So awesome.

snippet.textDisplay:
I must say I didn't care too much for this song. I hated sailing in this game, so BORING! Thumbs up if you cried as much as I did during the final fetch quest?

snippet.textDisplay:
Loved the art style. It's also akin to sprites, the graphics are timeless and will never go out of date like the graphics in OoT or Majora's Mask or any game at the time. 

Cel shaded graphics won't ever be out of date because it's style over technical prowess. Likewise with sprite based games like the old Mario games or Metroid.
snippet.textOriginal:

snippet.textDisplay: OoT had a special orchestra CD (search about Hyrule Symphony) but the music ingame was played by a computer. Even the orchestra version of Kakariko was just a virtual orchestra. snippet.textDisplay: Man i love the game, it's awesome

snippet.textDisplay: Ahh... For some reason, I always like being at sea. You sail waters, not knowing what'll happen, yet facing anything that comes your way.
snippet.textOriginal: Ahh... For some reason, I always like being at sea. You sail waters, not knowing what'll happen, yet facing anything that comes your way.

snippet.textDisplay: I love this music so much, and it fit the ocean perfectly. I only wish that the islands in the game weren't all cut and paste of eachother. >_>
snippet.textOriginal: I love this music so much, and it fit the ocean perfectly. I only wish that the islands in the game weren't all cut and paste of eachother. >_>

snippet.textDisplay: This song is soothing enough that it always used to make my wife fall asleep if I was playing Zelda.  She would actually suggest that I play GameCube so that she could take a nap.
snippet.textOriginal: This song is soothing enough that it always used to make my wife fall asleep if I was playing Zelda.  She would actually suggest that I play GameCube so that she could take a nap.

snippet.textDisplay: So true. The entire overworld was nothing more but a 7x7 grid.
snippet.textOriginal: So true. The entire overworld was nothing more but a 7x7 grid.

snippet.textDisplay: This music is impressive and so encouraging when using the sailing boat. I love it.
snippet.textOriginal: This music is impressive and so encouraging when using the sailing boat. I love it.

snippet.textDisplay: This is my favorite rendition of the Zelda main theme, also my favorite overworld music from any Zelda title.  It actually made sailing those tremendous distances bearable, which is saying something.
snippet.textOriginal: This is my favorite rendition of the Zelda main theme, also my favorite overworld music from any Zelda title.  It actually made sailing those tremendous distances bearable, which is saying something.

snippet.textDisplay:
it's...so...big!!!!!!
This brings back so many memories of the game!
Also, the sea wuz huge!!!!!!!!
snippet.textOriginal:
it's...so...big!!!!!!
This brings back so many memories of the game!
Also, the sea wuz huge!!!!!!!!

snippet.textDisplay: I prefer this one over PH's. I've heard PH's so much now that I'm sick of it :X
snippet.textOriginal: I prefer this one over PH's. I've heard PH's so much now that I'm sick of it :X

snippet.textDisplay: Perfect traveling music!
snippet.textOriginal: Perfect traveling music!

snippet.textDisplay: This game is my favorite Zelda because of the art style and because of how satisfying the combat was.
snippet.textOriginal: This game is my favorite Zelda because of the art style and because of how satisfying the combat was.

snippet.textDisplay: If you started playing from like, the first ones, you get used to how most of the puzzles work, so it ends up getting easier and easier with each new Zelda game. =P
snippet.textOriginal: If you started playing from like, the first ones, you get used to how most of the puzzles work, so it ends up getting easier and easier with each new Zelda game. =P

snippet.textDisplay: Truly a beautiful piece. My favorite music in the game.
snippet.textOriginal: Truly a beautiful piece. My favorite music in the game.

snippet.textDisplay: Nintendo will never release any Philips CD-I crap on the VC!!!!! There will be no Hotel Mario and the 3 horrible Zelda titles! That is a rumor and it needs to die!!!
snippet.textOriginal: Nintendo will never release any Philips CD-I crap on the VC!!!!! There will be no Hotel Mario and the 3 horrible Zelda titles! That is a rumor and it needs to die!!!

snippet.textDisplay: Oh, and my favourite Zelda is A Link to the Past. The puzzles just got too easy after that.
snippet.textOriginal: Oh, and my favourite Zelda is A Link to the Past. The puzzles just got too easy after that.

snippet.textDisplay:
My only real beef in this game were a couple of the music choices. Xylophones? In a dramatic battle? Shoot me now.

Other than that, it was nice to see a Link that actually new swordsmanship (swashbuckling, not fencing) and it quite a few good music scores to make up for the abysmal. Go Molgera!
snippet.textOriginal:
My only real beef in this game were a couple of the music choices. Xylophones? In a dramatic battle? Shoot me now.

Other than that, it was nice to see a Link that actually new swordsmanship (swashbuckling, not fencing) and it quite a few good music scores to make up for the abysmal. Go Molgera!

snippet.textDisplay:
hourglass well you cant expect much on the d.s
there are very few good games on that system
only megaman zx and pokemon exceled on the d.s

majora's mask was very very different from other zelda games
it was much more dark
but still
i'd say it was good
snippet.textOriginal:

snippet.textDisplay: Best one!...I wish I hadnt stoped playing this..But it got old..Fast..I miss this music..Faved. 5/5
snippet.textOriginal: Best one!...I wish I hadnt stoped playing this..But it got old..Fast..I miss this music..Faved. 5/5

snippet.textDisplay: I'm not sure I could name my favorite Zelda game to be honest! I pretty much loved them all except (and don't hurt me!) Majora's Mask and Phantom Hourglass.
snippet.textOriginal: I'm not sure I could name my favorite Zelda game to be honest! I pretty much loved them all except (and don't hurt me!) Majora's Mask and Phantom Hourglass.

snippet.textDisplay:
orcarina of time is my fav

tbh the cel-shaded graphic werent to bad
the game play makes up for it by far
in fact
i think im going to go play it right now
snippet.textOriginal:
orcarina of time is my fav

tbh the cel-shaded graphic werent to bad

snippet.textDisplay: Agreed. The cel-shaded graphics are still amazing today.
snippet.textOriginal: Agreed. The cel-shaded graphics are still amazing today.
